intro: Androlepis najarroi, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has a taproot system and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its ornamental value also makes it a popular garden plant.
